page.title: 01GAZETTEER
page.content: Under Local Government reorganisation in 1975 the three burghs of{Gourock},{ {Greenock }and {Port Glasgow }were linked to form {Inverclyde }District. Despite this, the burghs retained their separate identities and the area covered by this survey is the East end of Greenock and the West end of Port Glasgow. The area is bounded by the {River {Clyde }to the North and the Renfrewshire Hills to the South. The old shipyards with large dry dock, now converted to oil-rig building, runs the length of the river. Behind them are houses and the Southern border is high moorland with a few farms situated in the hills.
